result.markdown:
--- title: "Lecture 6.2" subtitle: "Democracy and Redistribution" author: "Emmanuel Teitelbaum" footer: "[PSC 2339 Website](https://psc2339.com)" logo: "images/cpe_logo.png" format: revealjs: theme: moon transition: fade slide-number: true view-distance: 10 css: custom.css execute: echo: false freeze: auto --- # Poverty ## Definitions
- Poverty--a lack of money, material possessions or means - Income-based approach (World Bank) - Capabilities approach (Amartya Sen) - Inequality--the unequal distribution of wealth and opportunity in a society ## Measuring Poverty - "Headcount ratio" - Percentage of population below a poverty line - Associated with income-based approach - Multidimensional poverty index - Associated with capabilities approach - Measures "intensity" of poverty, not just frequency - Incorporates health care, education and living standards ## Extreme, Moderate and Relative Poverty (Sachs) - Extreme poverty or “absolute poverty” - Cannot meet basic survival needs - Moderate poverty - Basic needs are just barely met - Relative poverty - Lack access to tools for upward social mobility - Applies mainly to high income countries (Sachs 2005) ## Poverty Lines ($ per day 2017 PPP)
- Extreme poverty: $2.15 - LMIC threshold: $3.65 - UMIC threshold: $6.85 ## Extreme Poverty ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/extreme_poverty_map-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Regional Trends in Extreme Poverty
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
## LMIC Threshold ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/lmic_map-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## UMIC Threshold ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/umic_map-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Global Trends at Different Thresholds ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/three_thresholds-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Multidimensional Poverty ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](lecture-6.2_files/figure-revealjs/multidimensional_poverty_map-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## U.S. Extreme Poverty ::: columns :::: column ![](images/deaton.jpg) :::: :::: column - Angus Deaton - [“The U.S. Can No Longer Hide from Its Deep Poverty Problem”](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/24/opinion/poverty-united-states.html) - $4/day poverty line - Life expectancy of poorest Americans less than Bangladesh or Vietnam - Health indicators declining, not getting better :::: ::: ## Discussion - Go to Gapminder [Dollar Street](https://www.gapminder.org/dollar-street) - Pick a family - Where do they fall on the poverty scale? - Extreme - Moderate - Relative - Not poor - What would be the biggest challenge of living like that family? # Latin America ## Inequality Trends
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
## Poverty Trends
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::

## Key Concepts - ISI (Import substitution industrialization) - Formal and informal sector workers - Contributory benefits, e.g. traditional pensions - Noncontributory benefits - CCT (conditional cash transfer) - NCP (non-contributory pensions) ## Holland and Schneider - What is easy vs. hard redistribution? - What do they want to explain? - Competing explanations - Electoral competition - Deindustrialization - Partisan ideology - What is their explanation? - Come up with one good question about the reading

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
